column5: I've always been a Lowrance user but had a thought to pick up a seperate unit for back lakes and ice fishing.   http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...0001000_200-1-1   Any experiences good or bad? At that $ it's disposable!
Hey ya Fang.  I had a bottom line  years back. Never had any issues with it.Used both on the boat and on the hard water.For that price,I cant see ya going wrong.
Looks like a great deal to me.
Have a buddy who loves them.....
Ran one for years no problem with the unit.   Art
I guess it must have been a typo as its disapeared today, just when i was gonna make the drive and get me one,,,grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

You guys watch Bottomline in the next coupla years. They're going to be a force to be reckoned with. They almost made it a few years back but now the big players are getting fat and lazy and starting to make mistakes.

I was at BPS last night to pick up a new fishfinder. The selection/stock is pretty slim from what the guy told me. I had a quick look at the bottomline stuff they had, but it didn't look like they had any available. Worth a call before you make the trip.  Oh, and good thing BPS price-matches - after I bought my Humminbird, i found out that LeBaron has it for $30 less! Now i just have to go back to BPS to get the difference back - saves me from making a trip to both stores.
Roy you speak wize words. When they came out, they had the best pix,but IMO they priced themselves out of the market.  If they come up with a gps/sonar for a resonable price,Im getting one.
